library(magrittr)

### How to use the results files from DBSLMM


```{r, echo = TRUE, message = FALSE}
(hsq <- params$hsq)
(scenario <- params$scenario)
(distribution <- params$distribution)
(n_replicates <- params$n_replicates)
(alpha <- params$alpha)
resfn <- paste0("../dat-quant/DBSLMM/scenario", scenario, "/", distribution, "/hsq", hsq, "/res.rds")
if (!file.exists(resfn)){
  out <- list()
res <- lapply(1:n_replicates, function(x, hsq = hsq, scenario = scenario, distribution = distribution) {
  knitr::knit_child(
    'cv-plus-simulations-child.Rmd', 
    envir = environment(), 
    quiet = TRUE
  )
  get("out")
})

saveRDS(res, file = resfn)
} else {
  res <- readRDS(resfn)
}
```


```{r}
coverages <- lapply(X = res, 
                    FUN = function(mytib){
  mytib %>%
    dplyr::summarise(coverage = mean(in_interval))
       }
)
do.call("rbind", coverages) %>%
  tibble::as_tibble() %>%
  dplyr::mutate(trait_num = 1:length(res))
```

## Boxplots of interval width

```{r}
for (i in 1:length(res)){
  res[[i]] <- res[[i]] %>%
    dplyr::mutate(trait_num = i)
}
dplyr::bind_rows(res) %>%
  ggplot2::ggplot() + 
  ggplot2::geom_violin(ggplot2::aes(x = trait_num, y = interval_width, group = trait_num))
```
